messages.title: A note before you send off your postal vote
messages.content:
With a snap election giving us little time for preparation, I have agreed to stand again as parliamentary candidate, in order to mount a full challenge to the wave of attacks that our NHS, our schools, our environment and people on low incomes are facing at the moment.
Those waiting for months in pain for an operation or queuing at A&E don’t need me to spell out what’s happening to our NHS. School governors and head teachers don't need me to tell them the amount of hours they spend trying to make ends meet with shrinking budgets. People whose wages have not risen with inflation struggle to make ends meet.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We’ll stop the privatization of the NHS and merge health and social care to create a seamless service.
We’ll stop cuts to schools and help struggling schools by putting more money into them.

Merging health and social care will give disabled people and older people joined-up services, reducing hospital stays & helping people stay at home. We need to end 15 minute rushed care visits and pay carers properly.
Protect our natural environment, working with local communities.
Increase affordable housing to rent and to buy, including appropriate homes.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe we need an MP who will make a difference, whether helping an individual with a problem, working to get the best deal for local workers and businesses, supporting voluntary organisations or arguing the case with ministers for local causes. I did this for 13 years. If you give me the opportunity, I will do so again.
